intro: Mediocalcar ternatense, commonly known as the Ternate sandmat, is a flowering plant native to Indonesia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, adapting to saline environments. It has a compact growth habit with hairy stems and lobed leaves. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
